item.title: Find and Remove Files That Have Spaces In The Name
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description:
Whenever I need this, it takes me seemingly forever to figure this out. Blog it!

‘find’ is a great GNU utility for digging up files in directories. ‘rm’ is a staple command for any linux user. Combining the two commands can be fun and powerful.

find /home/luser -type f -name '\*.mpg' -exec rm -f {} \\;

The above command calls rm -f for each file. A faster version of this uses xargs for a single call.

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA shortcut in linux
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description:
After a lot of digging around, I finally came across this blog entry telling how to make a shortcut to IDEA work in linux. In short, change your shortcut to something like the following:

/bin/sh -c "export JDK_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun && /opt/IntelliJIdea8/bin/idea.sh"

Voila! Victory is mine!

item.title: Clicking Things
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description:
For a month or so now, I’ve been having problems with clicking buttons in Eclipse and in Flash. After asking in the Eclipse IRC room, I was able to find an answer that actually fixes both Eclipse and Flash.

Eclipse (from the wiki) I’ve created a startup script that sets the following system property. export GDK_NATIVE_WINDOWS=true

Flash (from this post) Pretty much the same fix as above but made in a different place. In /usr/lib/nspluginwrapper/i386/linux/npviewer, add the following: export GDK_NATIVE_WINDOWS=1

item.title: Google Gears for 64-bit Linux
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
item.description: While this isn’t really news at this point, I figure spreading the word can’t hurt. I use Gmail and several of the other Google applications (calendar, reader, docs, etc). Google has added offline support to a few of these apps via their Google Gears Firefox addon. This can be great news unless you are running 64-big linux. There is not an official release of Google Gears of 64-bit linux. There is, however, an unofficial and totally sweet build available. The builder does a great job of staying up to date with the builds usually within a release or two of the official builds. If you travel or just like to handle email and such when offline, this can be a great help. Enjoy!

item.title: Linux seen through different Windows
item.author: carl@halls.farm (Carl Hall)
